bwwExcerpt: This sporadically fun musical from - where else! - Great Britain with a loony book by David West Read suggests this idea is somehow very feminist; that taking a dagger for your poisoned man is the ultimate failure of the Bechdel test. A bit self-righteous coming from a show that includes "I Kissed a Girl and I Liked It" by Katy Perry, dontcha think? The key to enjoying yourself at "& Juliet" - and it is, indeed, an empty-headed good time - is to ignore the plot entirely a

keyPhrases.quote: it is, indeed, an empty-headed good time

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic acknowledges the show as fun entertainment ('empty-headed good time') but criticizes the book and finds the feminist messaging self-righteous, resulting in a qualified mixed recommendation. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses significant skepticism about the show's substance while acknowledging some entertainment value, leading to a mixed recommendation. | Note: Models differed by 12 points.
